title: Rant!.. we can't drink out of plastic straws and can't use plastic ...
body: Silicone straws have some of the same issues; they can be even harder to clean because of the flexibility, and silicone does degrade eventually as well, just a lot slower than plastic. Paper straws degrade much faster than plastic, even the ones that could even be classed as cardboard - they get wet and fall apart and that is a potential ...
readable_content:
- Picklesthepeacefrog (2022-11-30): Rant!.. we can’t drink out of plastic straws and can’t use plastic plates/cutlery…. But we can ship shovels in single use plastic… shovels something that you leave outside..
  Shitpost 
  Archived post. New comments cannot be posted and votes cannot be cast.
  Sort by:

  - Greedy_Sandwich_4777 (2022-11-30): Working in retail, unpacking deliveries everyday really opens your eyes up to how far we have to go.

  - StJBe (2022-11-30): Work in a factory then you'll see some huge quantities of trash and packaging.
  1 more reply

  - whiney1 (2022-11-30): Get into recycling soft plastics with redcycle. Save up a couple bag fulls, drop off at most supermarkets. Crazy how quickly it adds up once you start.
    Afaik they actually get recycled too.
  2 more replies

  - filthysuckerfish (2022-11-30): How dare you leave your new shovel outside.
    2 more replies

  - remember_myname (2022-11-30): Totally agree, we also used to tie pallets up with bale twine to transport them, now they are completely wrapped in cling film
  ...
summary:
The conversation reflects frustration and concern about the inconsistency in environmental regulations, particularly regarding the banning of plastic straws while other single-use plastics are still being used. There is also a sense of awareness about the issue of plastic waste and a call for more sustainable practices. 

Sentiment: 0.6
